====Readings====
{{ja-readings|goon=[[ひゃく]] (''hyaku'')|kanon=[[はく]] (''haku'')|kun=[[もも]] (''momo''), [[ほ]] (''ho''), [[お]] (''o'')|nanori=[[お]] (''o''), [[ど]] (''do''), [[どう]] (''dō''), [[なり]] (''nari''), [[ひゅく]] (''hyuku''), [[も]] (''mo''), [[もんど]] (''mondo''), [[ゆ]] (''yu'')}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|ひゃく|yomi=o}}
{{bor|ja|ltc|sort=ひゃく|百|tr=pæk||hundred}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|ひゃく|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ひゃく}}

# [[hundred]]
# a very [[many]], [[lots]], [[a lot]]
# one [[hundred]] years old, advanced [[age]]

=====Usage notes=====
This is the most common term for {{m|en|hundred}} in modern Japanese.

=====Idioms=====
{{der-top|Idioms}}
* {{ja-r|百に一つ|ひゃく に ひとつ}}: “one in a hundred” → something [[rare]] or [[unusual]]
* {{ja-r|百も承知|ひゃく も しょうち}}: “awareness of the hundred” → the state of being [[fully]] [[aware]] of something
{{der-bottom}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}

* {{ja-r|百千|ひゃくせん}}: a large number, all sorts, hundreds and thousands
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|もも|yomi=k}}
{{IPAchar|/mo<sub>1</sub>mo<sub>1</sub>/}} → {{IPAchar|/momo/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=もも}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|もも|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|もも}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=もも|archaic}} [[hundred]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=もも|archaic}} a very [[many]]

=====Usage notes=====
While ''ho'' or ''o'' is only used in compounds, ''momo'' can be used on its own.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Archaic. Generally only found in set phrases or compounds.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|百日|ももか}}: [[hundredth]] [[day]]
* {{ja-r|百声鳥|ももこえどり}}: the ''[[Cuculus poliocephalus]]'' or {{vern|lesser cuckoo}}
* {{ja-r|百舌|もず}}: the [[shrike]]
* {{ja-r|百千|ももち}}: a large number, all sorts, hundreds and thousands
* {{ja-r|百千鳥|ももちどり}}: [[all sorts]] of [[bird]]s, hundreds and thousands of birds; a [[plover]]; a [[Japanese bush warbler]]
* {{ja-r|百年|ももとせ}}: hundred [[year]]s, [[century]], a long time
* {{ja-r|百夜|ももよ}}: a hundred [[night]]s
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|ほ|yomi=k}}
{{IPAchar|/po/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɸo/}} → {{IPAchar|/ho/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ほ}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|ほ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ほ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=ほ|obsolete}} [[hundred]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=ほ|obsolete}} a very [[many]]

=====Usage notes=====
While ''momo'' can be used on its own, ''ho'' is only used in compounds, where it has lost the initial consonant and appears instead as ''o'' (see below). Generally only used in reference to multiple hundreds of things, as in terms {{m|ja|五百|tr=io||five hundred; a very many}} or {{m|ja|八百|tr=yao||eight hundred; a very many}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Obsolete. [[supersede|Superseded]] by ''o'' (see below).

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|お|yomi=k}}
{{IPAchar|/po/}} → {{IPAchar|/ɸo/}} → {{IPAchar|/ho/}} → {{IPAchar|/o/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=お}}. Change in pronunciation from ''ho'' (see above).<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kun|お}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|お|hhira=ほ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=お|archaic}} [[hundred]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=お|archaic}} a very [[many]]

=====Usage notes=====
While ''momo'' can be used on its own, ''o'' is only used in compounds. This ''o'' was originally pronounced ''ho'' (see above). Generally only used in reference to multiple hundreds of things, as in terms {{m|ja|五百|tr=io||five hundred; a very many}} or {{m|ja|八百|tr=yao||eight hundred; a very many}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

Archaic. Generally only found in set phrases and compounds.

=====Derived terms=====

* {{ja-r|三百|みお}}: three hundred
* {{ja-r|四百|よお}}: four hundred
* {{ja-r|五百|いお}}: five hundred; a very many
* {{ja-r|六百|むお}}: six hundred
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|七百|ななお}}: seven hundred
* {{ja-r|八百|やお}}: eight hundred; a very many
* {{ja-r|九百|ここのお}}: nine hundred
* {{ja-r|八百万|やおよろず}}: eight million; a great [[multitude]], a [[countless]] large number or amount
